text: Maria Owings Shriver, (born November 6, 1955) is an American author and journalist. ==Early life== Shriver was born on November 6, 1955 in Chicago, Illinois. Her parents were Sargent Shriver and Eunice Kennedy. Her uncles were John F. Kennedy, Robert F. Kennedy, and Ted Kennedy. Her cousins are Robert F. Kennedy, Jr., Caroline Bouvier Kennedy and John F. Kennedy Jr. ==Journalism career== She was co-anchor of NBC News and covered 1988 Summer Olympics. She has won many Emmy Awards. ==Personal life== In addition, she is former First Lady of California when her husband Arnold Schwarzenegger was governor. They divorced in 2021. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:Kennedy family Category:Writers from Chicago Category:Emmy Award winners
title: Maria Shriver
